snippet: Mr. Rubio’s campaign released statements for his Republican Party of Florida-issued American Express card, hoping to at last quiet accusations that he used party money to pay for trips, meals and gifts for him and his family.
abstract: Questions remain about Republican presidential candidate Marco Rubio's mishandling of finances despite release of his 2005 and 2006 credit card statements; move meant to assuage doubts shows history of missed payments and intermingling of personal and professional expenses; supporters claim Rubio is being singled out for common behavior.

byline.original: By JEREMY W. PETERS, STEVE EDER and JEREMY B. MERRILL

lead_paragraph: Mr. Rubio’s campaign released statements for his Republican Party of Florida-issued American Express card, hoping to at last quiet accusations that he used party money to pay for trips, meals and gifts for him and his family.

headline.main: Marco Rubio’s Use of Party Credit Card Reinforces a Picture of Messy Finances
headline.print_headline: Rubio’s Use of Party Credit Card Reinforces a Picture of Messy Finances
